org.eclipse.january.dataset

Class AbstractCompoundDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyDatasetBase
      • org.eclipse.january.dataset.AbstractDataset
        • org.eclipse.january.dataset.AbstractCompoundDataset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CompoundDataset, Dataset, IDataset, ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompoundByteDataset, CompoundDoubleDataset, CompoundFloatDataset, CompoundIntegerDataset, CompoundLongDataset, CompoundShortDataset

    public abstract class AbstractCompoundDataset
extends AbstractDataset
implements CompoundDataset
    Generic container class for data that is compound in nature Each subclass has an array of compound types, items of this array are composed of primitive types Data items can be Complex, Vector, etc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getTransposedView

        public CompoundDataset getTransposedView(int... axes)
        Description copied from interface: IDataset
        Permute copy of dataset's axes so that given order is old order: 
          axisPerm = (p(0), p(1),...) => newdata(n(0), n(1),...) = olddata(o(0), o(1), ...)
  such that n(i) = o(p(i)) for all i
        I.e. for a 3D dataset (1,0,2) implies the new dataset has its 1st dimension running along the old dataset's 2nd dimension and the new 2nd is the old 1st. The 3rd dimension is left unchanged.
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface CompoundDataset
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface Dataset
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface IDataset
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface ILazyDataset
        Overrides:
        getTransposedView in class AbstractDataset
        Parameters:
        axes - if zero length then axes order reversed
        Returns:
        remapped view of data

      • getView

        public abstract AbstractCompoundDataset getView(boolean deepCopyMetadata)
        Specified by:
        getView in interface CompoundDataset
        Specified by:
        getView in interface Dataset
        Specified by:
        getView in class AbstractDataset
        Parameters:

      • variance

        public double variance(boolean isWholePopulation,
              boolean... ignoreInvalids)
        Description copied from interface: Dataset
        The sample variance can be calculated in two ways: if the dataset is considered as the entire population then the sample variance is simply the second central moment: 
            sum((x_i - m)^2)/N
 where {x_i} are set of N population values and m is the mean
    m = sum(x_i)/N
        Otherwise, if the dataset is a set of samples (with replacement) from the population then 
            sum((x_i - m)^2)/(N-1)
 where {x_i} are set of N sample values and m is the unbiased estimate of the mean
    m = sum(x_i)/N
        Note that the second definition is also the unbiased estimator of population variance.
        Specified by:
        variance in interface Dataset
        Overrides:
        variance in class AbstractDataset
        ignoreInvalids - - see Dataset.max(int, boolean...)
        Returns:
        sample variance

      • variance

        public CompoundDataset variance(int axis)
        Specified by:
        variance in interface CompoundDataset
        Specified by:
        variance in interface Dataset
        Overrides:
        variance in class AbstractDataset
        Returns:
        sample variance along axis in dataset
        See Also:
        with isWholePopulation = false

      • variance

        public CompoundDataset variance(int axis,
                       boolean isWholePopulation,
                       boolean... ignoreInvalids)
        Specified by:
        variance in interface CompoundDataset
        Specified by:
        variance in interface Dataset
        Overrides:

        Returns:
